no.geosoft.jwlf

Class JsonWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.geosoft.jwlf.JsonWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class JsonWriter
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Class for writing JSON Well Log Format logs to disk.

    Typical usage: 

       JsonWriter writer = new JsonWriter(new File("path/to/file.json"), true, 2);
   writer.write(jsonLog);
   writer.close();
    If there is to much data to keep in memory, or the writing is based on a streaming source, it is possible to append chunks of data to the last JsonLog instance written, like: 
       JsonWriter writer = new JsonWriter(new File("path/to/file.json"), true, 2);
   writer.write(jsonLog);
   writer.append(jsonLog);
   writer.append(jsonLog);
   :
   writer.close();
    Note that the pretty print mode of this writer will behave different than a standard JSON writer in that it always writes curve data arrays horizontally, with each curve vertically aligned.

    If the JSON log header contains a valid dataUri property, the curve data will be written in binary form to this location.

    Author:
    Jacob Dreyer
    See Also:
    https://jsonwelllogformat.org

    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonWriter

        public JsonWriter(OutputStream outputStream,
                  boolean isPretty,
                  int indentation)
        Create a JSON Well Log Format writer for the specified stream.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - Stream to write. Non-null.
        isPretty - True to write in human readable pretty format, false to write as dense as possible.
        indentation - The white space indentation used in pretty print mode. [0,>. If isPretty is false, this setting has no effect.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If outputStream is null or indentation is out of bounds.

      • JsonWriter

        file - Disk file to write. Non-null.
        isPretty - True to write in human readable pretty format, false to write as dense as possible.
        indentation - The white space indentation used in pretty print mode. [0,>. If isPretty is false, this setting has no effect.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If file is null or indentation is out of bounds.

      • JsonWriter

        public JsonWriter(File file)
        Create a JSON Well Log Format writer for the specified file. Writing is done in pretty print mode with an indentation of 2.
        Parameters:
        file - Disk file to write. Non-null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If file is null.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(JsonLog log)
           throws IOException
        Write the specified log.

        Multiple logs can be written in sequence to the same stream. Additional data can be appended to the last one by append(no.geosoft.jwlf.JsonLog). When writing is done, close the writer with close().

        If the log header contains a valid dataUri property, the curve data will be written in binary form to this location.

        Parameters:
        log - Log to write. Non-null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If log is null.
        IOException - If the write operation fails for some reason.

      • append

        public void append(JsonLog log)
            throws IOException
        Append the curve data of the specified log.

        This feature can be used to stream data to a JSON destination. By repeatedly clearing and populating the log curves with new data there is no need for the client to keep the full volume in memory at any point in time.

        If the log hedaer contains a valid dataUri property, the curve data will be written in binary form to this location.

        NOTE: This method should be called after the JSON Well Log Format metadata has been written (see write(no.geosoft.jwlf.JsonLog)), and the JSON log must be compatible with this.

        When writing is done, close the stream with close().

        Parameters:
        log - Log to append to stream. Non-null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If log is null.
        IllegalStateException - If the writer is not open for writing.
        IOException - If the write operation fails for some reason.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Append closing brackets and close the back-end stream.
        Specified by:

      • toString

        public static String toString(List<JsonLog> logs,
                              boolean isPretty,
                              int indentation)
        Convenience method for returning a string representation of the specified logs.

        Note: If a log header contains the dataUri property, this will be masked for the present operation so that curve data always appears in the returned JSON string.

        Parameters:
        logs - Logs to write. Non-null.
        isPretty - True to write in human readable pretty format, false to write as dense as possible.
        indentation - The white space indentation used in pretty print mode. [0,>. If isPretty is false, this setting has no effect.
        Returns:
        The requested string. Never null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If logs is null or indentation is out of bounds.
